channel.title: Ed's Space - Trips
channel.description: Recent content on Ed's Space - Trips

item.title: Overland Track - Further Details
item.description: This page is dedicated to describing all the equipment I brought (and wish I brought), all the costs of the trip (not including equipment and food), and the food I brought (and wish I brought)

item.title: Dec 2022 Tasmania, Australia
item.description: In lieue of going to China, who have yet to sort out their COVID situation, Winn and myself organised another road trip like the previous year’s, but this time to Tasmania!

item.title: Oct 2022 Thailand
item.description: My partner, Winn, booked this flight during a massive sale and at a time when Thailand’s border entry still had some restrictions due to COVID. But, it only cost us 250 AUD return (that’s right, $250 for there and back!) for each of us. The bet paid off and Thailand lifted all restrictions and we were free to enjoy our super cheap holiday in Thailand! This trip was a short one - only 7 nights, so we had to make the most of the time we were there! Winn was a champion and organised most, if not all, of the schedule.

item.title: Dec 2021 Adelaide, Australia
item.description: My partner, Winn, and her family typically take an annual trip to Guang Zhou, China during the summer break as a family. Unfortunately, China still had borders locked to prevent COVID from entering the country. Instead, Winn planned a road trip for the family to Adelaide, departing from their place in Melbourne, with a stopever in Grampians on the way back. On the trip would be Winn, her parents, her youngest brother (Stone), and myself. We would all fit inside a Nissan Elgrand (like these but grey/silver) which can fit 7. We planned on staying overnight at places along the way to Adelaide, and two nights in Adelaide itself.

item.title: Dec 2020 Wilson's Prom Eastern Circuit, Australia
item.description: What better way to celebrate the easing of COVID lockdown measures than to go out for a 2-night hike in Victoria’s beautiful Wilson’s Prom?

item.title: Sep 2019 Austria
item.description: I was in Austria for a workshop in Vienna for my Masters. Besides Vienna, I made stops to Insbruck, and Salzburg (where the Sound of Music was shot).

item.title: Feb 2019 Japan & Taiwan Cycle Trip
item.description: This was originally a Japan-only trip with a friend. She could no longer make it, so I made this an opportunity to tick off a bucket list item: cycling around the circumference of Taiwan. I’ve wanted to do this since I learnt of the No. 1 route that goes around Taiwan. To add to this, I thought it would be fun to attempt to cycle Tokyo to Osaka as a “warmup”.

item.title: Feb 2019 NZ South Island
item.description: I gratefully tagged along with my housemate on this trip. He wanted to make this trip purely for the Milford Sound Track, which he missed out on due to inclement weather. We stayed on the South Island - mostly around Queenstown.

item.title: Apr 2018 Tasmania, Australia
item.description: My German housemate, who loves hiking and seeing what Australia has to offer, instigated this trip! Our other housemate came too. The trip was mostly hiking some of the mountains of Tasmania.

item.title: What I packed for TMB
item.description: For those also keen on doing the TMB!

item.title: Jul 2017 North Italy
item.description: I spent just under a month in Italy - two weeks for an Australian winter (Italian summer) University subject; and the rest for travelling around.

item.title: Oct - Dec 2016 India
item.description: This trip was part of a University subject that let you volunteer as report on your experiences. I chose to do a volunteer program with 40K Globe which lasted for a month. I spent a week either side of it travelling around.
